Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2013 01:30PM Brooksy wrote: I was diagnosed with tnbc may 21. I am doing chemo now and will have surgery when finished with chemo. While chemo is no walk in the park it is doable , the fear was worse than the actual treatment ( for me). I know everyone is different .
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Breast Cancer. How are you doing? Patti777 TifJ

Posts.Content: Brooksy wrote: I received my diagnosis last week. It was a total shock. I am 47 and do not have any family history. I have been told I have invasive ductal carcinoma triple negative at this time based on size they believe stage 2. I am a mess, and scared. I have a panic attack every time I get on the internet and start reading. I have seen a surgeon and will see the oncologist next week. Dx IDC, 2cm, Stage II, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, and scared to death Brooksy Brooksy

Posts.Content: May 31, 2013 10:05PM Brooksy wrote: I have not had any surgeries yet 2 mammos, us, and bx. I saw the surgeon and will see oncologist next week. They said for this type current recommendations are chemo first then surgery.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, and scared to death Brooksy Brooksy
